comment.author: 69645150@N05
comment._content: Edgar Abbot was born in Cornholme in 1895, the son of Arthur and Sarah Elizabeth Abbott. By 1911, aged 15, Edgar was working at Cornholme Bobbin Mill in Burnley Road, Todmorden. More information about the mill can be found at: freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~todmordenandwa.... Edgar Abbott's name is engraved on the Todmorden War Memorial in Centre Vale Park, Burnley Road. For a photograph of the memorial see either: freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~todmordenandwa... or en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Todmorden_War_Memorial.

comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content: His number, 18760, indicates an enlistment date of late April 1915.

comment.author: 69798423@N03
comment._content:
Edgar is listed as having landed in the Balkans on 18th August 1915. This tallies with him being a replacement for the 1/KOSB who were serving at Gallipoli at the time.

Birth Place: Carnholme, Lancs

Regiment: King's Own Scottish Borderers

Type of Casualty: Killed in action
Theatre of War: Western European Theatre
